page.title: 08Population of south: FINTRY
page.content: The uninhabited northern slopes of the Campsie Fells occupy over half the SW of the area. Of the{111 properties,} 4 are now empty. The present village centre (Main Street, by Fintry Bridge) has 55 households and there are 17 around the Kirk and Denny Road end to the east (Gonachan), 23 in the main section of the council estate over the river and 12 other residences & farms. {Half the households are families.} 70% with children under 16. 4 families have both parents working. {A quarter of households are single {people,}50% retired, most living in the scheme or Main Street. 27 households have no wage earners. {Total pop. 285,} {Labour market 136. {Work locally 50. }Own Business 13, Farming 11, Catering 10, Education 13, Medicine 10, Clerical 9, Managers 7, Uniformed 7, Council Workers 6.
